title: Public Rights of Way Materials Delivery and Handling
description: Worcestershire has around 16,000 individual public rights of way covering 4,600km.  This network, made up of footpaths, bridleways and byways, provides the public with a means of access on foot, horseback, cycle and, on a small number of routes, using motorised vehicles.  The network is used mostly for informal recreation but also in some locations, as important means of accessing shops, schools, places of employment and other services.Worcestershire County Council has the statutory responsibility to ensure that the county's public rights of way network is properly mapped and maintained and the network is unobstructed and available for use by the public.  This responsibility is managed by the Public Rights of Way (PROW) Team, working with landowners and occupiers, volunteers, probation service and appointed Service Providers. As part of this work, we need to deliver relevant Public Rights of Way furniture and materials to landowners, volunteers and between storage areas. Worcestershire is therefore looking to procure a supplier who would be required to deliver materials to landowners, and volunteers and occasionally work sites. The vast majority of this will be within the County of Worcestershire. Due to the rural and remote nature of these sites this may involve needing to drive down un-metaled access roads so the vehicle provided needs to be capable of this, such as a 4x4 pickup and twin axle trailer. Currently the main storage compound is located at Worcester Woods Country Park and a secondary compound is at Lydiate Ash Highway Depot. These locations may be subject to change. Operatives will be required to have a H&S induction for the compounds as well as having a Lone Working Policy and appropriate and relevant insurances .PLEASE NOTE THIS IS A RESTRICTED TENDER TO INVITED BIDDERS ONLY.Full information on requirements can be located in the Service Specification in the tender pack provided. Please ensure all documentation uploaded is read in full before completion of submission.Please make sure you "Express Interest" and then go to "Opt in" in order to view, upload and complete all relevant questionnaire and documentationThe closing date for all bids to be received will be: 12:00hr Friday 15th December 2023

title: Prior Information Notice - The Supply Of PROW Gates
description: The purpose of this Prior Information Notice (PIN) is to initiate a market engagement exercise for the procurement of various designs of gates for the use of the Council’s  Public Rights of Way team and to assess the interest and capability of the market to provide and deliver the Council’s current and future requirements.  Worcestershire has around 16,000 individual public rights of way covering 4,600km.  This network, made up of footpaths, bridleways and byways, provides the public with a means of access on foot, horseback, cycle and, on a small number of routes, using motorised vehicles.  The network is used mostly for informal recreation but also in some locations, as important means of accessing shops, schools, places of employment and other services.Worcestershire County Council has the statutory responsibility to ensure that the County's Public Rights of Way network is properly mapped and maintained and the network is unobstructed and available for use by the public.  This responsibility is managed by the Public Rights of Way (PROW) Team, working with landowners and occupiers, volunteers, and appointed Service Providers. As part of this work we need to provide relevant Public Rights of Way gates to landowners. Currently, Worcestershire County Council spends approximately £100,000 per year on gates. The Market Engagement Questionnaire is available via Worcestershire County Council's e-procurement portal at: -   www.in-tendhost.co.uk/worcestershire

title: Soft Market Test - ASC23043 Positive Behaviour Support Supported Living Dynamic Purchasing System
description: SOFT MARKET QUESTIONNAIRE - THIS IS NOT A CALL FOR COMPETITIONHerefordshire and Worcestershire Integrated Care System want to engage with the market on provision of a Positive Behaviour Support Supported Living Dynamic Purchasing System.  Providers on the DPS will be expected to provide either:•	Core and Cluster Enhanced PBS-led Supported Living – Support delivered within a cluster of properties with a shared core staff team, this could be bungalows, flats etc.  •	Single Service Enhanced PBS-led Supported Living Services in the community – This would be a residential property commissioned with a specific person in mind where they will have their own staff team.  These may be located close to cluster services.Services will be provided to adults aged 18 and over, this may be 16 if the support provider can be registered to support people from this age whose needs cannot be met in the ordinary supported living provision. Services will be provided to individuals who meet one or more of the following criteria:•	with a recent history of multiple placement breakdowns.•	presenting a high risk of admission/re-admission to locked or secure service.•	with a high risk of offending/re-offending.•	with a mild Learning Disability and Mental Health diagnosis who have a high risk of relapse requiring specialist intervention.•	with high risk of harm to self or others.•	with a diagnosis of people who have high risk of admission to a long stay hospital, and behaviours that challenge who present with behaviours that challenge services.•	people who are listed on the Dynamic Support Register.•	people who have complex sensory processing issues.Please review the service specification attached (click View Synopsis button), answer the following questions and send your response back via email to adavis@worcestershire.gov.uk by 4pm on 3rd November 2023.All responses will be treated as confidential and not shared with other organisations, however, the final specification and tender model may be influenced by this and other stakeholders.Full Name:Organisation: Contact Email: Q1. Do you have any comments on the procurement approach of a Dynamic Purchasing System (open list of providers) for positive behaviour support services?Q2. What structure would you put in place for a PBS-led service? - how many staff, covering what area?Q3. What would a wider MDT look like for this service?- do you have your own MDT?- if yes, what is included?- can elements of this be purchased when needed?- how do you link with NHS provided MDT elsewhere?Q4. Do you have any comments on the eligibility for the service?Q5. Do you have any comments on the service delivery principles?Q6. Do you have any comments on the service outcomes?- are any missing?- any that aren’t appropriate?Q7. Any comments on the service requirements?Q8. What would your hourly rate be for this service (note this is just for market engagement purposes and NOT a call for competition)?Q9. Is there a minimum level of service you would need to provide services in Herefordshire and Worcestershire?Q10. Are you currently planning any developments of this kind in Herefordshire and Worcestershire?Many thanks for taking the time to complete this questionnaire – please ensure you monitor the Council’s Intend portal to ensure you don’t miss future tender opportunities.

title: Market Engagement Event – ASC23043 Positive Behaviour Support (PBS) Supported Living Dynamic Purchasing System
description: MARKET ENGAGEMENT EVENTHerefordshire and Worcestershire Integrated Care System want to engage with the market on provision of a Positive Behaviour Support Supported Living Dynamic Purchasing System.  Please note: THIS IS NOT A CALL FOR COMPETITIONWe would like, at this tentative stage in the development of proposals, (and prior to formulating any formal procurement opportunity), to seek input from the market as to what the appetite might be for undertaking these services.Providers on the DPS will be expected to provide either:•	Core and Cluster Enhanced PBS-led Supported Living – Support delivered within a cluster of properties with a shared core staff team, this could be bungalows, flats etc.  •	Single Service Enhanced PBS-led Supported Living Services in the community – This would be a residential property commissioned with a specific person in mind where they will have their own staff team.  These may be located close to cluster services.Services will be provided to adults aged 18 and over, this may be 16 if the support provider can be registered to support people from this age whose needs cannot be met in the ordinary supported living provision. Services will be provided to individuals who meet one or more of the following criteria:•	with a recent history of multiple placement breakdowns.•	presenting a high risk of admission/re-admission to locked or secure service.•	with a high risk of offending/re-offending.•	with a mild Learning Disability and Mental Health diagnosis who have a high risk of relapse requiring specialist intervention.•	with high risk of harm to self or others.•	with a diagnosis of people who have high risk of admission to a long stay hospital, and behaviours that challenge who present with behaviours that challenge services.•	people who are listed on the Dynamic Support Register.•	people who have complex sensory processing issues.Herefordshire and Worcestershire Integrated Care System would like to invite interested organisations to meet with us for an informal discussion around service delivery, to be held as follows:  13th November 202310:00am – 12.30pm Virtual Meeting via Microsoft Teams Please note this event will be recorded and made available afterwards along with all Powerpoint SlidesIf you have any questions about the event, please email the event organizer: amiron@worcestershire.gov.uk Eventbrite Entries: https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/market-engagement-event-asc23043-positive-behaviour-support-dps-tickets-741551599797•	If you experience any difficulties accessing Eventbrite, please email above to register your place.•	Please register your place on Eventbrite or to the email above by 8th November and shortly following that date you will be sent a link to a Teams Meeting Invite via email.

title: ASC23040 Provision of a Replacement Care Service at Lock Close,  Redditch for Adults with a Learning Disability
description: Worcestershire County Council (“the Council”) is looking to appoint a provider to deliver a stimulating and person-centred 5 bedded replacement care service for adults with a learning disability at 1 Foxlydiate Mews, Lock Close, Redditch. The Provider will be expected to enter into a sub-lease arrangement with the Council with regard to occupancy of the building at Lock Close of which the provider will be charged a peppercorn rent.  Lock Close is one of a number of services that the Council commission to provide overnight replacement care across Worcestershire. The provider is expected to achieve the outcomes and requirements of the specification. The Council will monitor compliance with these outcomes. The service will be subject to review, potential change, and innovation over the lifetime of the contract.

title: Prior Information Notice - Traffic Signals Term Contract (TSTC) 2024
description: The contracting authority is Worcestershire County Council (WCC), which is a non-metropolitan county in the West Midlands. It has an area of 1,735 km2 and a population of 598,000 (2020), and the County highway network consists of 3,900 km of roads that includes 113 traffic signals junctions and 192 pedestrian crossings. WCC require the services of a Traffic Signals Contractor. The service will generally be located within the County of Worcestershire or on those highways maintained under agreement by WCC, and consists of:•	Maintenance of Traffic Signals, Pedestrian Controlled Crossings, •	First line maintenance of Variable Message Signs (VMS) and Carpark Management Systems (CMS), and •	Installation and renewal of Traffic Signals and Pedestrian Controlled Crossings.The service to be provided does not include the supply or installation of VMS & CMS. A draft Inventory of Sites and Equipment, for indicative purposes only, is provided with this PIN notice. The procurement will be an open procedure, for a single supplier contract, under an NEC3 Term Services Contract, Option A - Priced Contract with Price List. It is anticipated that the tender will be published in late Autumn 2023, with a tender period of approximately five weeks. The contract duration is an initial period of 6.5 years, with potential to earn extensions up to a total of 11.5 years, subject to performance. The Client currently anticipates a spend of approximately £0.5m per annum on maintenance work. The value of new and renewals work is variable, but historically has averaged approximately £300k per annum. These values are given for guidance purposes only and do not form a contractual commitment.

The County and City Councils are working together to regenerate the  Shrub Hill area as an employment led mixed use regeneration zone benefitting from more frequent train services to and from Worcester and the major urban conurbations and investment in improving facilities for railway users at Shrub Hill Station.IMH was built in the 1930s as offices for the adjacent engineering works and consists of approximately 50,000 ft2 gia of employment space currently arranged as cellular offices on the ground and first floors and individual workshop units on the lower ground floor approached from the Lower Yard. title: ASC23042 Deprivation of Liberty Safeguards Assessments (DoLS): Project to Complete Backlog of Cases 2023-24
description: Worcestershire County Council (“the Council”) is looking to appoint a provider to manage a backlog of Deprivation of Liberty Safeguards (DoLS) cases. The Council will appoint either a single organisation applying itself to provide the Service, a consortium with legal status or an organisation applying as the lead organisation for two or more organisations who wish to provide the service as a consortium without legal status.Approximately 635 DoLS cases would have to be completed and submitted to the DoLS team within 46 to 52 weeks of the project commencing. In addition to this, there may be a requirement for the completion of up to an additional 40 cases per month throughout the time of the project until such time that the DoLS team has obtained staffing to complete these on an ongoing basis.

title: EDU23024 Enhanced Early Years Nursery Provision
description: Worcestershire Children First (WCF) are looking to broker an Enhanced Early Years Provision (EEYP) for children whose identified complex needs make it difficult to attend an early year provision. The intention is to deliver EEYP within South Worcestershire as a pilot.WCF are looking for a provision within Worcester City or Malvern and have assessed the current sufficiency need could be up to 35 children a year. WCF are also looking for a provision in Wychavon and have assessed the current sufficiency need could be up to 25 children a year. WCF have evidence of an increase in the numbers of children needing an Enhanced Provision over the last several years. It is anticipated that the numbers required will increase. This will need to be reviewed as part of the pilot.Contract will be for 3 years starting 1st January 2024 to 31st December 2026, with an option to extend for a further year, plus a further year (maximum 5 years) dependant upon the success of the pilot.If you wish to view the documents for this opportunity please click `Express Interest`. title: CSC23069 Independent Information, Advice, Mediation and Support for Foster Carers and Organisational Membership for Worcestershire Children First Fostering
description: Worcestershire Children First Fostering (WCFF) is the preferred provider of fostering placements for Worcestershire looked after children, through referral from Worcestershire Children First. Currently there are 264 approved foster carer households, caring for around 360 children. Approximately 100 of our approved foster carers live within or nearby to Worcestershire. Around 103 of our approved foster carers are kinship carers, and as such they may live outside of the Worcestershire area.We are seeking a preferred provider of independent advice, mediation and support for foster carers who must be able to provide accessible services for approved foster carers in their local area, for example, if there was an allegation and a foster carer was required to attend a police interview, then this service would have to be made available in the locality in which the child and the carer reside. We would require Foster Carers to have access to a case worker and legal advice and support if attending a police interview.The provider will need to be able to respond to fluctuations in the number of approved carers. For example, there are approval of temporary foster carers under Reg 24 and also foster to adopt foster carers throughout the year. We also are seeking to increase foster carer households through planned recruitment campaigns throughout the year.We are also seeking organisational membership. WCFF operates with around 58 employed staff and around 19 fostering panel members. Each member of staff and fostering panel member needs to be able to access the organisational benefits that membership brings.If you wish to view the documents for this opportunity please click `Express Interest`. Following this, if you wish to apply for this opportunity please click `Opt in` which will then enable you to view and complete the Standard Questionnaire and upload the relevant documents.After uploading all required documents and completing the questionnaire(s) please remember to press the `Submit your Return` button at the bottom of the page. Places should be made accessible for all children with disabilities.  In addition to WCFs funding detailed in this specification, additional places can be funded via Direct Payments, parental contribution towards a subsidised place or privately paid for. title: ASC23003 Wrap Around Care Service
description: The aim of the wrap around care service is to support people to return, and remain, at home following a stay in hospital by delivering 24/7 care in the person’s own home for an intensive short period (between 2 and 10 days). This should prevent, or delay, the admission into residential care and promote personalisation and independence.  The service will support individuals to regain and maintain activities of daily living, and thereby reduce reliance on long term care and support and help them to return to live at home, as independently as possible. title: CSC23039 Independent Advocacy Service  for Parents or Carers  in need of additional support
description: Worcestershire Children  First (WCF) are seeking to commission a service provider who can offer an Independent Advocacy Service to eligible parents/carers within Worcestershire.When there are concerns regarding the capacity of a parent/carer to look after their child or children who may or may not have Special Education Needs and Disabilities (SEND), social care services may become involved. Social services may decide to offer targeted family support, implement a Child in Need (CIN) plan or to initiate care proceedings for the child/children to become Child Looked After (CLA). This can be an extremely emotional and distressing time for those involved and some parents/carers may require additional support, from an Independent Advocate, to aid their understanding of the process and/or assessments.If you wish to view the documents for this opportunity please click `Express Interest`. title: Custody Healthcare Services
description: Hampshire and Isle of Wight Constabulary invites applications from suitably experienced organisations who wish to be considered for selection to tender for the provision of Custody Healthcare Services . The Contract will commence on 7th June 2024 and will be for a period of three years with the option to extend for a further four years.Interested parties should register their interest in the project via the In-Tend website https://in-tendhost.co.uk/hampshire, and complete and submit the tender return document together with any supporting information requested by 14.00 hrs on Monday 13th November 2023.  How to obtain the Tender DocumentsThe Tender documents can be accessed when logged into In-Tend by selecting ‘View Details’ on the relevant tender advert and clicking the ‘Express Interest’ tab. Once in the tender there are five tabs – ‘Tender’, ‘ITT – documents’, ‘Correspondence’, ‘Clarifications’ and ‘History’. Select the 2nd tab (ITT - documents) where you will find useful information under ‘Tender Details’ continue to scroll down to the heading ‘Tender Documents Received’ where you will be able to view / download the documents.Please download all the documents and read very carefully.Opting In and Opting OutPlease note you are required to ‘Opt In’ before you can access the ‘My tender Return’ to start populating your response. PLEASE NOTE you are required to ‘Opt In’ to view & complete the Questionnaire for this project. The ‘Opt Out’ functionality will also be available throughout the duration of the tender process. Opting out will give you the option of declaring you no longer want to receive any further communication in relation to this tender along with the opportunity of providing comments and feedback for this decision.You can choose to ‘Opt In’ at any time during the tender process if you initially decided to ‘Opt Out’.Further GuidanceIn addition, guidance on how to participate in a tender – download and upload documents / returns and if required, register your company (free of charge), can be found on the In-tend site under the ‘Help’ or ‘Information for Suppliers’ buttons.Receiving Notification EmailsTo ensure you receive email alerts and notifications from our system, please add the email domain `@in-tendorganiser.co.uk`  to your Safe Senders list.
